description: A playful misunderstanding between a director and an actress highlights the humorous side of theater expressions.
title: The Casting Call
n_1: Backstage, Danny gives last-minute advice to Lila before her performance.
n_2: Lila's confusion over the phrase is evident, but she's ready to embrace the challenge.
n_3: On stage, Lila's literal interpretation leads to a comically exaggerated performance.
n_4: The audience laughs, and Danny is proud of Lila's creative improvisation.
c1_1: Remember, Lila, go out there and break a leg!
c2_1: Break a leg? Okay, if you say so, Danny!
c1_2: That's the spirit! Show them what you've got!
c2_2: I'll give it my all, even if it means a 'broken leg'!
c1_3: That's not what I meant, but she's owning it!
c2_3: Ouch! My leg! But the show must go on!
c1_4: Great job, Lila! You really know how to cast a spell on the audience!
c2_4: Thanks, Danny! I guess I really 'broke a leg' out there!
